titleStmt.title: Z. Wheat et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette

The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Shelby County Kentucky
To his excellency Gov. T. E. Bramlette

Mr E. M. Wilson of this county was fined on the 8th inst by a jury before Geo. L. Harbison a Justice of the Peace for this County the sum of Twenty five dollars for an assault on T. G. Doolin -- A portion of us heard the testimony and others of us from what we know of the case and the character of Testimony believe that the fine was altogether unjust -- We therefore beg your excellency to remit the same except the costs --
The said Doolin was the main witness, supported by the testimony of two returned rebel soldiers he being a sympathiser himself, and we believe the whole thing was the result of prejudice
I do not know the facts, but Doolin is a Contentious man. & was not a competent witness, & I would be glad if you would remit the fine

Z Wheat
Geo C McGrath
D. H. Masonhimer
Jas Lowry
C M Harwood
T P H. Mason
H. M Buckley
Jno, W, White
James C Price
G, W, Fishback
J, L, Atherton
Washington Adams
James G. Byers
F Neel
John M McGrath
George Petry
S. E, Kinkeads
H B Martin
A. P. Hickman
B, H, Crapstie
G W Caplinger
J. t. Cardwell
John E. Matthews
John A Hornsby
Geo N. Robinson
A. F. Price
J. B. Cochran
John Robinson
John Q Ballard
